title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: The New Package Wizard displays a confusing message when no package name is entered.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package Wizard, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' is shown at the top before any input is provided. This message appears even when the package name field is empty.
EB: The message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not be displayed when the package name field is empty. Instead, an appropriate message or instruction should be shown to guide the user in creating a package.
SR: Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new Java Project. 2. Select the project. 3. Invoke the New Package Wizard.
